author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: العَزِيزُ الْكَرِيمُ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَسْئَلُكَ بِأَنْ لا تَطْرُدَ مَنْ أَرادَكَ وَلا تَمْنَعَ مَنْ قَصَدَكَ وَلا تَحْرِمَ مَنْ أَحَبَّكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَنْتَ الَّذِيْ سَمَّيْتَ نَفْسَكَ بِالرَّحْمنِ ثُمَّ بِالرَّحيمِ، فَارْحَمْ أَمَتَكَ الَّتِيْ لاذَتْ بِكَ وَتَوَجَّهَتْ إِلَيْكَ
translation: Cast not out, I entreat Thee, O my Lord, them that have sought Thee, and turn not away such as have directed their steps towards Thee, and deprive not of Thy grace all that love Thee. Thou art He, O my Lord, Who hath called Himself the God of Mercy, the Most Compassionate. Have mercy, then, upon Thy handmaiden who hath sought Thy shelter, and set her face towards Thee.
